intro: Isotrema ovatifolium, commonly known as the ovate-leaf isotrema, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its ovate, glossy leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are small and clustered, often with four petals, and it produces small, spherical fruits. Isotrema ovatifolium is primarily of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
